intro: Pinalia grandicaulis, commonly known as the tall stalked pinalia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Pinalia grandicaulis is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low water availability, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
